snippet: The developer of the World Trade Center site is seeking a better deal from the Port Authority to build the next tower. The agency should stick to its original plan.
abstract: Editorial criticizes package proposed by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey for additional financing for developer Larry Silverstein to build a second skyscraper at the World Trade Center site; calls package unnecessary, as it could easily create a glut of office space, since the 104-story 1 World Trade Center is only about half-leased.
lead_paragraph: The developer of the World Trade Center site is seeking a better deal from the Port Authority to build the next tower. The agency should stick to its original plan.

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
